body.header:
Read this sample answer to the writing task in the last exercise and find the mistakes. There are 12. Click on them.
Writing Task 1

section.p: The chart shows views held by New Zealanders who attend cultural events regarding the quality of these events. It is quite clear from the figures that they tend to disagree on most cultural issues. There are, however, a few issues on which opinions differ.

The strongest agreement noticeable is in connection with the importance of cultural activities in school and the benefits culture brings to our lives. Almost three-quarters of those who agree say they strongly agree that children should be involved in cultural pursuits at school. On the other hand the vast majority agree that cultural activities enrich our lives and bring us closer together. Almost two-thirds of those who agree on this do so strongly. Similarly, the population is not such unanimous on some issues than it is on others. For example, about half the population do not agree that sport is more important as culture, while the other half think it is. Just over half of New Zealanders hold this view strongly. In contrast, although most New Zealanders believe that they have a sense of their cultural identity, a significant minority, just under 1 in 10, do not feel this way.
Although they do not agree on all issues, it seems overall that most New Zealanders have fairly positive attitudes towards their nation's cultural life.
We don't know if the people surveyed attended cultural events or not.
The quality of the events is not referred to in the chart. A better phrase would be ...regarding cultural matters.
For three of the five statements, the vast majority agree or agree strongly.
74 per cent refers to New Zealanders.
What follows this linking phrase contrasts or contradicts the point which is made before. So it could be ... However,
We use 'as...as' to compare things. 'Such as' introduces examples.
'Than' follows as comparative adjective, 'bigger than' for example, but not comparatives with 'as'.

p.font: ...on some issues as it is on others.

section.p: After a comparative adjective we use 'than', not 'as'.
...those who think sport is more important...
The point that follows this linking phrase is another example of what New Zealanders disagree about.
